metadata.description: Core thesis experiments (Pursuit-Evasion): Embedding Dimension x Training Swarm Size matrix. Reduced from 70 to 20 configurations. Tests dimensional reduction hypothesis across 4 training sizes and 5 embedding dimensions on PE task.
metadata.design_rationale: Parallel to rendezvous core matrix: [4,16,50,100] pursuers x [4,8,32,64,128] embed dims x 1 seed. Single seed per config; prioritize second seed for highest-variance (large N, small d) if time permits.

matrix_parameters.description: Core matrix: 4 training sizes x 5 embedding dimensions x 1 seed = 20 unique configs. Auto-expanded via config_utils.py.

pursuer_count_selection.description: Pursuer counts [4, 16, 50, 100] parallel to rendezvous core matrix for cross-task comparison.
reasoning: Matching agent counts enables direct comparison between rendezvous and PE tasks.
Dropped N=32 for efficiency (intermediate value without qualitative novelty).

embed_dim_selection.description: Same embedding dimension range as rendezvous core for consistent thesis narrative.
reasoning: d=[4,8,32,64,128] tests information bottleneck through saturation regime.
d=64 enables baseline comparison across tasks.

seed_strategy.description: Core uses single seed; prioritize second seed for high-variance PE configs if time permits.
seed_strategy.note: PE task typically has higher variance than rendezvous (more dynamic evader), so second seed may be especially valuable.

_example_num_pursuers4_embed_dim4_seed0.description: Minimal pursuer team, bottleneck embedding. Tests lower bound of mean embedding on PE.

_example_num_pursuers100_embed_dim128_se.description: Large pursuer team, high-dimensional embedding. Tests scalability at maximum scale on PE.

experiments._abbreviated: Full 20 core configs auto-generated from matrix_parameters by config_utils.py. Naming: num_pursuers{N}_embed_dim{D}_seed{S}.
